message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.GT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with inapproximability results for two natural vertex deletion problems on directed graphs, which are classic topics in theoretical computer science and graph theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also uses the Unique Games Conjecture, which is a well-known open problem in theoretical computer science, suggesting that it could be relevant to cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The paper also involves some geometric arguments, which could relate to cs.CG (Computational Geometry). The paper also discusses the relationship between the DAG Vertex Deletion problem and the Discrete Time-Cost Tradeoff Problem, which could be relevant to cs.GT (Game Theory) or cs.LG (Machine Learning).
